intro: Oxydectes gnaphalii, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oxydectes gnaphalii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
